赫.definition: awe-inspiring; abbr. for 赫茲|赫兹[he4 zi1], hertz (Hz)

赫哲族.definition: Hezhen ethnic group of Heilongjiang province

赫哲語.definition: Hezhen language (of Hezhen ethnic group of Heilongjiang province)

赫圖阿拉.definition: Hetu Ala (Manchu: Yellow Rock), Nurhaci's capital at the 1619 Battle of Sarhu

赫山.definition: Heshan district of Yiyang city 益陽市|益阳市[Yi4 yang2 shi4], Hunan

赫山區.definition: Heshan district of Yiyang city 益陽市|益阳市[Yi4 yang2 shi4], Hunan

赫德.definition: Hart or Herd (name); Robert Hart (1835-1911), Englishman who served 1863-1911 in Qing dynasty customs office

赫曼·麥爾維爾.pinyin: hè màn · mài ěr wéi ěr
赫曼·麥爾維爾.definition: Herman Melville (1819-1891), US novelist, author of Moby Dick 白鯨|白鲸[Bai2jing1]

赫然.definition: with astonishment; with a shock; awe-inspiringly; impressively; furiously (angry)

赫爾曼德.definition: Helmand (name); Helmand province of south Afghanistan, capital Lashkar Gah

赫爾穆特·科爾.pinyin: hè ěr mù tè · kē ěr
赫爾穆特·科爾.definition: Helmut Kohl (1930-), German CDU politician, Chancellor 1982-1998

赫特河公國.definition: Principality of Hutt River (formerly Hutt River Province)

赫耳墨斯.definition: Hermes, in Greek mythology, messenger of the Gods

赫胥黎.definition: Huxley (name); Thomas Henry Huxley (1825-1895), British evolutionary scientist and champion of Darwin; Aldous Huxley (1894-1963), British novelist

赫魯曉夫.definition: Nikita Khrushchev (1894-1971), secretary-general of Soviet Communist Party 1953-1964

赫魯雪夫.definition: see 赫魯曉夫|赫鲁晓夫[He4 lu3 xiao3 fu5]
